scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: Shannon
scrape.text: If you've read The Dinner and want a place to talk about it with spoilers, we're discussing it over at The Socratic Salon.The Dinner is what I wish every thriller would be, a brilliant work of building and restraint. While some have complained that the beginning is slow, I think that Koch establishes his characters perfectly - particularly with Paul's relateable, snarky comments. Once the "Main Course" started to fall into place, I read the second half of the book in one sitting. Shocking without being over the top or unbelievable, The Dinner deserves all of its bestselling praise.
